title: Derivative Equation
text: The derivative of the function f(x) at a is defined by $$\lim_{x\toa} \frac{f{\left(x\right)}-f{\left(a\right)}}{x-a}$$.
speech: The derivative of the function f(x) at a is defined by  the limit as x 	oa, of fraction, f of x minus f of a, over, x minus a,  .

title: Plugging In
text: Plug $$4$$ into a and expand the equation.
speech: Plug  4  into a and expand the equation.
pacedSpeech: into a and expand the equation.

title: Simplify
speech: Simplify the resulting equation:  fraction, the square root of x minus the square root of 4 over, x minus 4,
